name: Canvas & Bear Paint Pouring Workshop
description: Play with colours and patterns with this satisfying art technique. Let loose and express yourself in a fun and fluid way. Embrace the unpredictable patterns to create a one of a kind piece of art. No experience needed.

name: Outside Looking In - Canada’s Largest Indigenous Youth Showcase
description: Indigenous youth from across Canada will take centre stage in Toronto for an electrifying performance at Outside Looking In’s 18th Annual Showcase. Featuring 100 dancers from 14 communities, this year’s theme, “Share the Flame,” fuses hip-hop and Indigenous cultures in a high-energy theatrical experience. Inspired by fire - a sacred symbol of healing, connection and strength in Indigenous traditions - the performance will take audiences on an awe-inspiring journey of transformation and resilience. Acclaimed Mohawk composer, storyteller, and JUNO and Canadian Screen Award-winner, Shub returns as a special guest performer, joined by MTV VMA and Indigenous Music Award-winning hip-hop artist, songwriter, and actor Drezus.

name: Glow in the Dark Paint Night Workshop
description: Do something outside of the box with this unforgettable paint night! Enjoy a guided sensory experience that will bring out your inner artist. Immerse yourself in our luminescent art studio and create a unique glowing masterpiece—no experience needed. Snacks and refreshments included.

name: Canvas Connection: Date Night Paint Night Workshop
description: Welcome to a candle-lit, romantic and artistic evening like no other! Bring your partner out for a unique experience where you'll collaborate to create a set of two paintings that will make one connected masterpiece together!

name: Introduction to Birding
description:
Join us for a beginner-friendly introduction to the birds of Downsview Park. Binoculars are not required but are encouraged.

Participants under the age of 16 must be accompanied by an adult.

Pets are not permitted at this program. Service animals are always welcome.

Our Education programs are proudly supported by TD Friends of the Environment Foundation.

French language service is available upon request. Please let us know.

name: Friday Night Ukrainian Jazz Dinner with StarDust Jazz Trio
description: StarDust Jazz Trio bring a truly unique genre of world music fusion to the stage, taking well-known traditional Ukrainian pop and folk classics and presenting them in their own infectious jazz-infused arrangements featuring the scintillating vocals of Zhanna Zinchenko, tasty piano licks from Victor Kowalenko, and driving bass by Stephan Lang (Koshyts).

name: Mother's Day Chocolate Making Workshop
description:
Join us to ignite the chocolatier in you with this hands-on chocolate making workshop. During this workshop you will be guided through the process of making delectable hand-rolled truffles. You will choose various fillings and learn how to appreciate chocolate with all five senses. 

This is a perfect activity for a fun Friday night out with mom and daughter. Spots are limited. For more information, please visit our website.

name: Wine Fest Toronto 2025
description:
Raise your glass and indulge in a celebration of fine wines! Whether you're a seasoned connoisseur or just starting your wine journey, this festival brings together a curated selection of international and local wines for an unforgettable tasting experience.

Enjoy exclusive samplings, gourmet food pairings, live music, and engaging conversations with winemakers and sommeliers. Gather your friends and sip your way through a weekend of discovery in the heart of Toronto!

name: Dinosaur Improv
description:
After sold-out runs across the country, Dinosaur comes to Toronto for a limited engagement at The Second City. This all-star improv phenomenon—hailed as “phenomenal” by Vanyaland and “one of the best things to do in L.A.” by LAist features an electrifying cast of comedy’s sharpest improvisers delivering a completely unscripted, entirely unique night of comedy.

Cast includes Chad Carter, Lisa Gilroy, Jason Mantzoukas, Seth Morris, Lennon Parham, and Paul Scheer

Every performance is a one-night-only explosion of unscripted hilarity—no script, no plan, just some of the funniest people alive making it all up as they go.

name: OCAD U GradEx: Creative Writing x Onsite Gallery
description: Join us for an evening to celebrate this year’s OCAD U Creative Writing graduating cohort. Experience a diverse showcase of poetry, music, theatre, and more as students share selections from their thesis projects. Come support and enjoy an inspiring night of words, storytelling, and performance

name: Be Water Journal Tour - Opening Night with Ed Pien and Johannes Zits
description:
Coming to San Cafe for its seventh stop, this tour features a powerful selection of works from the Be Water Journal — an annual magazine book that spotlights artists around the globe engaging with themes of environment, ecology, social justice, and cultural identity. 

Enjoy a panel talk and special video screening. See featured artists include Zheng Bo, Shi Tanding, Henk Wildschut, and Claudeverett.

name: Thursday Late Night Live Electronic Music Party with Botany
description: Botany, an electronic music/live remix group. What we bring is a blend of planned electronic textures, beats and vocals and real-time improvisation, creating an immersive experience that is experimental while incredibly danceable and recognizable. Our performances have been compared to a live mixtape/DJ style performance, but with the added energy and appeal of a live band. In combining a wide range of rhythms, tempos, and harmonies while also seamlessly transitioning between songs, we are able to create an engaging musical experience for the audience, delivering a unique and memorable show.
